resources.string: You can add a photo, such as of an appointment card or map.

Food Resources

Food Banks

Vancouver Food Bank

To find which food bank  is closest to you, please phone 604-876-3601, Mon-Fri  8:30-4:00.
Usually food banks are closed the week the income assistance cheques are given.

https://www.foodbank.bc.ca/find-help

City Reach Food Bank
The Food For Families program is a weekly nutritious food bank for families with children living at or below the poverty line. We offer wholesome, nourishing food appropriate for growing brains.
The food bank operates every Tuesday evening (Doors at 6:00pm and food bank from 7-8:30pm), and Thursday morning (Doors at 9:30am and food bank from 10:30-12 noon). Our office hours are Monday to Thursday 9am-5pm.
It is run by Broadway Church, but is not in a church building. Located in “the Warehouse” 2650 Slocan St (near Broadway), across from the Van Tech soccer field.  Closest skytrain in Renfrew.
There is a $5 one-time registration fee.  Please bring ID to register.
Contact Damaris or Sarah S.  for more information.
http://broadwaychurch.com/cityreach/

Covenant House
Covenant House provides shelter, free food and much more, for youth 16-22
Fri -  women only drop-in 9:30 - 12:00, snack provided
Mon/Fri hot meal 3:30-5:00
Thurs sandwiches 1:00-4:00
http://covenanthousebc.org/   604-875-7474

Broadway Youth Resource Centre
BYRC provides counselling, free food and much more for youth under 24
Mon/Tues/Wed/Thur/Fri breakfast 10:00-11:00 am
Mon/Tues/Thur/Fri lunch 1:00 pm ; Wed 2:30
Thurs dinner 5:00 pm
LOCATION:
#103 - 2780 East Broadway Street
Vancouver, BC, V5M 1Y8
CONTACT:

Fax: 604-709-5721

http://www.pcrs.ca/services

Cedar Cottage Neighbourhood House Aboriginal Family Night
For Aboriginal families who live in East Van
Tues dinner 6:00 – 8:00 pm
4065 Victoria Dr.
Please call Sharnelle to say you’re coming.  604-874-4231

Quest Food Exchange
Quest operates four not-for-profit grocery markets where clients can shop by referral. Families can access healthy food at an affordable price, and are empowered to make their own choices about what they purchase.
2020 DUNDAS ST., VANCOUVER, BC V5L 1B1
Tel: 604-602-0186 Fax: 604-682-3494
Hours of Operation:
9am-4:15pm Monday-Saturday
Closed: Sunday and holidays
611 EAST HASTINGS ST., VANCOUVER, BC V6A 1R2
Tel: 604-605-0735
Hours of Operation:
9am-4:15pm Monday-Saturday
Closed: Sunday and holidays

For Youth Pregnancy and Parenting Program clients:  Good Food Bag

Through the generous donation from ProOrganics, the Good Food Bag program can provide you with fresh fruits and vegetables for only $2.

How to Join:
- You have to be in YPPP (Youth Pregnancy and Parenting Program) or Healthiest Babies Possible
- Let your dietitian know you are interested and pay $2.  She will sign you up.

How to get it:

- On the Tuesday, pick up your bags at:

Evergreen
Community Health Centre
3425 Crowley Dr
near Joyce skytrain
(North East Room)

Tuesday 1:30 – 3:00 pm

Dates for 2014
June 17
July 15
Aug 19
Sept 16
Oct 21
Nov 18
Dec 16

- You can be in the Good food bag program until your baby is 1 year old.
- Please call 604-675-3982  extension 3 if you can’t pick up your bag.
- If you don’t pick up your bag, you lose your $2 and can’t sign up again because many people want this program.

In partnership with United Way, ProOrganics and Sharing Farm

16-18 years. 72 hours clean/sober, no alcohol/drug use. Hot meals.

16-22 years. 3 meals. No alcohol/drug use 12 hours prior; no detoxing. Curfew. Structured service.

Family setting, serving teens not in care who ordinarily live in Vancouver, Richmond or North Shore

Walden Safe House - Vancouver
604-877-1234
16-18 yrs. 3 meals. Hard drug-free. Goal-oriented.

Shelter Information - All Ages and Genders

BC 211 – A region-wide referral line for shelter and other essential services
211 or 604 875-6381

BC Housing/Rental Assistance Program (RAP)

  • Although there is a long wait for BC Housing, it doesn’t hurt to be put on the list.

    There are two ways to apply, on-line or through filling out their application form http://www.cra-arc.gc.ca/E/pbg/tf/rc66sch/rc66sch-13e.pdf or call their office at 604-609-7024 to get more information.
    Their address is 101-4555 Kingsway, Burnaby B.C., V5H 4V8
  • Another option for housing is applying for the Rental Assistance Program.

    To be eligible, you need to answer these questions:
    Are you getting rent receipts, are there NO sponsorships in place, have you resided in the province for more than 12 months?
    If the answer is yes to all three, then do the on-line estimator with the social worker.

Treatment Services

www.peakhouse.ca
604-253-6319

Long-term residential treatment centre for youth aged 14–18.
1-877-218-7746

www.unya.bc.ca
604-322-7577

Supported Recovery Program

 28-day stabilization placements for youth aged 21 and under who are determining their next steps for addiction treatment.
www.plea.ca
604-708-2616

Detox Services

Family Services of Greater Vancouver
Community-based detox service for youth aged 16–21. Voluntary admission program with a harm reduction approach as the primary service delivery model.
Youth D-Talks Intake: (9:00am – 7:45pm daily) 1-866-658-1221
Afterhours intake: 1-877-872-4349 (24 hour admissions)

PLEA Community Services Society of BC
Community-based detox service for youth aged 16 and under.
www.plea.ca or youthdetox@plea.bc.ca 604-708-2616
Youth D-Talks Intake: (9:00am – 7:45pm daily) 1-866-658-1221

LGBTQ THIP
The Transgender Health Information Program [THIP] helps people access gender affirming information and resources across BC. All transgender-health related questions from youth, adults, families, health care providers and others are welcome.
Call 604-734-1514 or 866-999-1514 (BC wide) or email transhealth@vch.ca 

Qmunity
BC’s Queer Resource Centre. Prideline, information, referral and peer support.
1170 Bute St
www.qmunity.ca 604-684-5307

Dental care

Vancouver’s Community Dental Program

We are a public health dental program that provides preventive education and dental services for families living in the city of Vancouver. We can help your family prevent tooth decay.

We provide dental care and advice about dental health for babies and preschool aged children. We are presently seeing children grade seven and under for check-ups in our public health dental clinic. There are some limited services provided for pregnant women.  Our dental hygienist cleans teeth, and offers advice on good dental health for moms and babies. Our dentist provides a check up.

Make an appointment to see us:
Vancouver Community Dental Clinic
Second Floor - Grandview Woodland Community Health Centre
210 - 1669 East Broadway
Vancouver, BC V5N 1V9

By Telephone:
Please call from Monday to Friday between 8:30 am - 4:30 pm.
Tel: 604.675.3981

Youth Clinics

Vancouver Public Health Youth Clinics

Youth clinics offer free and confidential drop in services for youth up to and including age 24. Services are provided by trained health care providers and include:
• Testing for sexually transmitted infections
• Free condoms and water-based lubricant
• Emergency contraception
• Pap tests
• Free or low-cost birth control options
• Pregnancy testing and options counselling
• General counselling
Visit: www.vch.ca/youthclinic for more information and additional youth clinic locations.

Boulevard Youth Clinic

Hours: Tues 2:30 – 5:00pm, Thurs 3:30 – 6:00

Labour and Birth FAQ

When do I call the doctor?

A doctor is always on call for you at BC Women’s Hospital.  Dial 604-875-2161 and ask for the doctor on call for your doctor.

If you’re really worried, call 911 and ask foran ambulance to take you to BC Women’s Hospital.

Call your doc if:

  • You’re bleeding like a period
  • Your baby isn’t moving as much as usual
  • Your water breaks with or without contractions
  • You’re having more than six contractions in an hour
  • You’re worried
  • You need medication

How long is labour?

Some labours take a few hours, some take a few days.  Both are normal.  The average is 12 hours.

What helps with the pain?

  • Warm water:  a tub or a shower
  • Friends and family
  • A doula
  • Massage
  • Moving
  • Dancing
  • Music
  • Laughing Gas
  • IM Morphine
  • Epidural

When do I go to the hospital?

Call the doctor to help you decide.  604-875-2161

What happens if I go to the hospital too early?

You might go home again.

Who can come with me to the hospital?

Anyone you like.

Do I get an IV in labour?

If you get an epidural, yes.  An IV is a treatment for some labour complications.  In a normal labour without an epidural, you won’t need an IV.

What are my chances of having a Caesarian?

If your pregnancy is healthy, about one in ten.

Can I eat during labour?

Yes.

Do women in labour throw up a lot?

Yes.

Will I poop during the birth of my baby?

Yes.

What if I’m too tired to push my baby out?

You can rest a little while your body gets the strength to do it.

Breastfeeding Service

Vancouver Coastal Community Health Centres

Public Health Nurses are available for breastfeeding support by phone or in person on a 
drop-in basis Monday to Friday at Community Health Centres.  Call any centre for more 
information:

Three Bridges Community Health Centre
1292 Hornby Street 604-736-9844

South Community Health Centre

•  Robert & Lily Lee Family Community Health Centre  604-675-3980
•  Pacific Spirit Community Health Centre  604-261-6366

BC Women’s Hospital

BC Women’s nurse lactation consultants work (and carry a pager) Monday to Friday from 8:00 
a.m. until 4:00 p.m.  Our patient services are open to everyone.  A referral is not required. 
To make an appointment, please call 604-875-3135.

For Information about breastfeeding, please call: 
604-875-2282 or page 604-875-4200 #01445 or #01767

BC Women\'s Hospital
4500 Oak Street 
Vancouver, BC V6H 3N1
604-875-3135 or Direct line: 604-875-2282
Pager: 604-875-4200 #01445 or #01767
